Reviews.Title: “Good location but very basic”
Reviews.Author: reddomeggeddon
Reviews.Content: We got this last minute the day before and it was very cheap so I guess you get what you pay for. Very basic room with a somewhat uncomfortable bed but for the price no complaints. The area is pretty lively at night so avoid if that sort of thing bothers you. It's very close to all the places you might want to see in Downtown so we didn't spend too much time in the Hotel except to sleep. The staff were helpful and friendly. I'd recommend it if you need a budget hotel for a night or two in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it - it's cold and grotty”
Reviews.Author: MerchantAdventurer
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel while in transit to Victoria. The hotel felt worn and tired, the room was cold and poorly equipped. I was woken in the night to what sounded like a mouse scratching or eating something (the noise stopped when I would switch on the light). The front desk staff were perfunctory in the their approach.

Reviews.Title: “Depends when you go...”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: I stayed her on March 11th, 2012 and, although the room was old and dark, it was fairly clean and quiet and made a decent, inexpensive place to stay downtown. I stayed here again on March 31 when I went over for a hockey game and had a very different experience. They gave us room 104 overlooking Granville St and right above their nightclub; it was soooo noisy I barely slept a wink all night. When I got up the next morning I went to put on some coffee with the in-room machine and found it hadn't been cleaned since the last guests were there, it even had an old soggy filter bag of coffee grounds still in it. The desk clerk gave me 10% off the room, but I'm not sure I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: little_gnome
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here and I was just as happy with it the second time around. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is so convenient for getting around downtown and close to so many transit links. Keep in mind that the hotel is right on Granville street which has a very active nightlife, so if you have a front facing room, it will be a noisy! I'm sure I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, great value”
Reviews.Author: Ydnar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and once again I thought it was a great value for the money. My room was clean, no nasty surprises at all. There was plenty of parking (a Sunday evening), and while it's true that at nineteen bucks it's pretty expensive, that's very standard for a downtown property, and the hotel does not actually run the lot. That said, the City of Vancouver charges the highest parking tax of any major North American city (almost 36 per cent), so it's really not the property's fault. Regardless, the price and location makes this somewhere worth staying in my opinion. As I've noticed with almost all 'updated' hotels, they don't allow you to change the aspect ration on the flat screen TVs, so the picture is absolutely no better than the old ones, and of course the image is short and fat to fill the screen. The remote even had the correct button to use but it was not activated. Heating/cooling unit is finicky and takes some getting used to...

Reviews.Title: “Is All You Need”
Reviews.Author: Strangaa
Reviews.Content: You can make this 3 stars hotel into a thousands stars. I'm a foreign and I seriously my fellows, I saved about $75 a day by staying at this Howard Johnson on granville st, in vancouver instead of any hotel. Because i used this $75 towards any restaurant you wish in vancouver. Rooms are cleaned everyday and at all times. Staff are accommodating and nice. Overall I give this hOtels a 3 stars and a half instead of three!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel at it's finest.”
Reviews.Author: LanaDecle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson with my boyfriend from January 29 to February 1, 2012. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the room was a fair size (as was the bathroom). We stayed in a single room with a double bed. Unfortunately, the area may not feel safe to everyone especially at night, but I had no real issue with it at all- it's close to everything and we walked basically everywhere from there! The pub on the ground level of the hotel was also good ($5 pints of beer) and the atmosphere was good too. All in all I thought we got a great deal and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HoneyS45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson from 25th December 2011 to 3rd Janaury 2012. The hotel staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be as helpful as possible. The location of the hotel is great as it is situated in the heart of Downtown easy walking distance from all attractions and the main shopping area and surrounded by many places to eat and drink. I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. The only critisim I would have is that there is a night club next door and on the 1 night I decided to have an early night, I was able to hear the music from the club. A pair of ear plugs would be a must for anyone not planning to take advantage of the night life and decides to head to bed early!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away from home”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: We booked a nice room for our anniversary weekend, and would certainly come again. The jaccuzzi was a nice feature... Very helpful and friendly staff, a nice place to stay, close to everything. Great location withing the downtown, too. We're already thinking Valentine's Day... ;-)

Reviews.Title: “FUN FUN FUN”
Reviews.Author: Carlo C
Reviews.Content: We had sooo much!!! Stayed during the Grey Cup, paid a bit more, of course, reserved a faboulous suite with jaccuzzi tub and 2 bedroom suite. Staff was really nice, very accomodating, helped us with anything we needed. \check in and check out was fast and efficient. Evening staff and day time staff very very nice. We will definetely return!

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: ringdais
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Vancouver. Our stay was short and we arrived at 5.30am and had booked for the night before. We were made most welcome with our room being checked before we booked in to make sure it was ok. This hotel was walking distance to most attractions including Gastown and Granville Island. A must on Granville Island is the shop that sells stone carvings from Zimbabwe. In the doorway is Harry the Hippo, who you cant help but rub his tummy. The carvings are absolutely magnificent especially when you talk to the proprietor and find out a little about the carvers history.

Reviews.Title: “Place to go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monika M
Reviews.Content: We happened to book the weekend over the halloween period and we had sooo much fun! Hotel staff was very nice and courteus, room nice and clean, a bit on a smaller side, but we got used to that already, all big cities have that problem. Security was first class, some people tried to party in the hallways, but were sent to their rooms with warning that one more noise , they will be out, which was very nice, we wanted to go to sleep at some point. We went out, the whole Granville street was alive, it was amazing. we will definetely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “small room...good locations”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: it's another one of those small room granville street hotels. other than that everything was nice about the room. nothing fancy but clean & semi stylish.

Reviews.Title: “you want HOW MUCH as a dd”
Reviews.Author: tenspro2011
Reviews.Content: clean, great location, friendly staff, best rates in town!!! however they wanted $200.00CA for damage deposit /incidentals....AND 15.00 FOR wiifii

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: mrsvixen999
Reviews.Content: This last weekend was our anniversary. We booked through Priceline (which I've done many times) with a Visa debit card. We paid for our room in full on the card. When we went to check in, we were actually told my the woman at the front desk that "this isn't a REAL visa" card! They had no problems taking the payment for the room out, but it appears that they had a problem with using it for id, and/or a deposit. The woman was very rude and condescending and when I asked for a manager I was told there wasn't one available! To put it bluntly, she was a real b$itch! I work in customer service including tourism for 20 years and have never been treated so bad. After paying $170 cash/debit, we were able to check in. Then during the night my DH went into the bathroom and two cockroaches crawled out of the wall under the sink!!! When he reported it the next morning, a different front desk clerk basically called him a liar and then tried to say he was smoking in the room and charging him for it!! This was AFTER the same guy watched DH go outside and smoke!!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Once again...great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karin H
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in 3 years. This is our "official hotel" everytime we come to Canada. Clean rooms, great staff, great location, good price, what else can we ask for? Now we even get recognized by hotel housekeeping staff and front desk staff. They all are just great, and we can not wait till the next time. \once again, thank you for everything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay ...”
Reviews.Author: hugeabbafan
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for 1 night - could not fault the hotel, very airey & spacious. However, I wasnt keen on the area the hotel was based and therefore this would put me off booking there again unfortunately. I thought London was bad with homeless people but Vancouver beats it hand down. Didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “average but good location”
Reviews.Author: masi76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a room with 2 Queens. The room was quite small but clean and the bathroom even had a window. The hotel is in walking distance to Robson Street and the waterfront, good public transportation as it is on one of the main streets. Minus: We had to pay 1 $ for each suitcase/bag we left with the front desk because our room wasn´t ready yet. All in all an average city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel. good location. fair price”
Reviews.Author: 1_w0rld
Reviews.Content: Good location but not all that pleasant. Not good/not bad - very average. stayed 2 nights - good value. clean enough but unpleasant smells throughout entire building and rooms. staff also average

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Wrighty0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a room with 2 queen beds and bathroom. Basic rooms, clean and the guy on reception in the afternoon/evening shift was really friendly and helpful. We had a room facing Granville St which was noisy as the road is busy with traffic but inside the hotel it was quiet. For a basic and comfy place to stay Id recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good price good location”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, be careful which room they give you, some are noisy due to construction work next to the hotel and some have very weak Wifi connection. Could change room without a problem and was very happy afterwards. Good location for going out and shopping. Bus stopp in front of the hotel or 1Min walk for other directions.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: digby40
Reviews.Content: We had booked into this hotel from UK to spend 2 nights between the Rocky Mountaineer train and the cruise ship. I didn't want a high class hotel because I guessed we would be too tired to take much notice. However, we were very disappointed on arrival because the hotel isn't in a very nice district on the edge of Chinatown and the gloomy reception area opens on to a raucous bar. After check-in, and having some trouble getting all our bags up to the room, we faced a dingy, smelly room with an a/c unit rattling away in the window. (It didn't seem to do anything either!) Not at all what we wanted, so we cut our losses and checked out immediately to find a nicer hotel elsewhere in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Free parking in town, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicO2747
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a stop over between Vancouver Island and Sun Peaks as it had a free car park and what a great find, didn't look that good from the street but inside like a small boutique hotel, we checked in the room and were then given a fruit basket, nice touch, the room was clean and comfortable, no view but a great TV, it's above a pub but mid week the music stopped at ten, the Bfast was nice except the loud music. If you were hoping to visit downtown this may be too far out if no car, and there is a great Greek nearby called Safinari, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE WE WILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya H
Reviews.Content: You were greeted with smiling, welcoming faces. The room was spotless. You were in a perfect location to walk to a lot of main attractions/shopping. All in All it was a wonderful experience and we would and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small, old and cramped hotel rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jacobsdennis
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the front desk, we were greeted by someone who could barely speak/understand English. After asking for someone who better spoke my language, the front desk agent immediately noticed that I was travelling with a pet. She told me that their central reservations people had failed to let them know that I was travelling with a pet. She became upset and told me that pets were allowed, but that the "pet friendly" rooms here not that nice. I was shocked to hear a hotel staff member tell me that their hotel rooms were not that nice. However, our pet was with us, so we have no choice. Upon arriving in the room, the room appeared to be super old, and was super tiny! The room smelled like dog urine, with several stains on the carpet. We felt like second-class customers, just because we had a dog with us! This hotel was super expensive, plus they charged $25 per pet per night, in addition to holding a $250 retainer fee that they told me was because we had a small dog with us. They did give me back the $250 following them actually inspecting the room. Around the hotel was a lot of restaurants, grills, cafes and other eatery's. This hotel is located only 3 minutes from Canada Place and waterfront in Downtown, Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great value for service.”
Reviews.Author: Krahulcova
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very helpful and trust-worthy staff. I travel to Vancouver on business quite frequently and this is always my hotel of choice. The office suite rooms are cozy, equipped with all the necessities and internet access. The general manager Lucia Baranova is absolutely exceptional at her job and always makes my stay very pleasant and easy to organize. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: klcmassagetherapy
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a last minute room at the Howard Johnson, two weeks ago. The manager, Lucia Baronova was pleasant, professional and immediately helpful. I had to travel from the states with my son who is 8 months old, and she made sure that the room was ready for us and her supporting staff was courteous and assisted me with any requests that can happen last minute when traveling with an infant. Moms know, anything can down and sometimes, we just don't have enough hands. They were able to keep the stroller when I needed to run back to my room, and I knew it was safe and in good care. The room was fantastic. It was clean, the colors were bright and cheerful, and the bed was so comfortable. I was able to take care of business without leaving my room, as I had access to my own personal fax machine, a coffee maker with coffee provided and snacks. It meant any business I needed to do, which was the purpose of my trip, I was able to execute without any issues. I would go back any day. Their rates are competitive and the staff is incredible. I can't say enough about the manager, Lucia. She goes above and beyond to make a guest feel welcome. She's a major asset to their company. Thank you for a wonderful experience, I will recommend the hotel to everyone I can and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Booked 6 nights, stayed for one.”
Reviews.Author: BackporchBob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the downtown location. Booked for 6 nights at an average rate of $139, room was way too small for two guys in two double beds, bathroom was tiny. On a positive note, $20/day parking which is a decent price. Note: Best to book a room at rear of hotel, Granville is a busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Great Location, Great Times!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_H_10_87
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 2 night stay. To summarize, the hotel rooms were comfortable, had A/C and were clean. As for the customer service, we had a little dilema with the parking, someone threw a rock at our windsheild causing a little crack. This had nothing to do with the hotel, but as a good samaritan the fron desk offered no extra cost on our second party sharing the room and gave us free of charge on the parking. The location is between all the hot spots and I would recomend this hotel to anybody that likes hotspots. Thank you again to the staff of Howard Johnson for your understanding and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: Luba44
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this boutique hotel offering a very clean and comfortable suite in the heart of Vancouver for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Overall Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckLover17
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Howard Johnson many times a year and would never even consider staying anywhere else. The amazing, helpful service from Gabriella and the rest of the front desk staff is something that will keep me going back for years. This hotel has a great central location in downtown Vancouver and is within walking distance to almost anywhere you might want to go. Rooms are very clean and cozy, awesome for the reasonable price they provide. This place is great, I would and do recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gdoc66
Reviews.Content: My good friend Justin and I travel from Kamloops to Van several times a year to take in Canucks games, and for the past 3 years we've stayed at this hotel for every trip that we've made. We have never had a negative experience, and have been very pleased with the service that we've received and I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “moderate price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: unid5ntified
Reviews.Content: came here a few months ago with my friends, as a university student it is nice to find a moderately priced hotel in downtown Vancouver. Its location is excellent being close ON granville street and 4 blocks away from robson and a 10 min walk to rogers arena. I think location is very important when booking a hotel. Also the staff was extremely friendly and check-in was very quick and efficient. The rooms are kept very nice and clean. Even though it is an older building, everything is kept perfectly and it feels nice and cozy. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have EVER stayed at!!!!! AND SOMETHING BITES.........”
Reviews.Author: heatwavebrit
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel at 12.30 am the incompetent employee behind the desk couldnt read my booking form properly (even though is was sent to me by them) and told us that we couldnt stay as the reservation wasnt in my name but my bosses and that only he could check in. As she was holding the paper work , I was initially taking her word for it and asked her to let us stay and that we would get our boss to confirm in the morning as he has 3 young kids and would be asleep. she said that that was impossible, even though we had all the paper work. In reality my name WAS on the confirmation form, but she couldnt see it. She was incredibly rude, even though we hadnt done anything to provoke her. She asked me for a credit card even though it was to be charged to my bosses card, saying it was just to hold. Without authorization she put an authorized the payment with my checking card, which now means I have no access to that money, if she had stated that she would do a temporary charge, I would have used my cc. The next day when I went to give them my bosses cc, I found out that they had put a hold on my money in my checking. The next day the next agent at the desk was even ruder then the firs, if that was possible and told me that she was "pregnant and didnt need this" and refused to even entertain my grievance of the unauthorized transaction. When I came back to the desk after having to make an international call on my cell phone to get my banks fax# that she claimed that she needed to reverse the charge, I suggested, very calmly that if she couldnt deal with a complaint from a customer, because she was pregnant then she should hand over any such complaints to someone that could. The sarcasm dripped from her as she said she "thanked me for my suggestion" I am going to see the manager tomorrow, although i wont hold my breath for an apology. At no point in dealing with these 2 different employees did I get any kind of an apology, in fact they suggested and intimated that I was the idiot here and that i should shut my mouth. I was upset by their unprovoked treatment of me that I was unable to go to dinner, I had completely lost my appetite, thank you HO JO for completely ruined my last night in beautiful Vancouver. NOT ONLY THAT MY COLLEAGUE IS COMPLETELY COVERED IN BITE FROM GOD ONLY KNOWS WHAT

Reviews.Title: “A good value for an adventurous traveller.”
Reviews.Author: backstagecheryl
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that this hotel will not be for everyone. It is on the very edge of a neighborhood that a lot of people will find to be a seedy place. I am not one of those people so I had no problems with the location. Vancouver is a big city with a very diverse population and some of the more colorful citizens inhabit the street around this hotel. If you go one block the other direction, however, it is all of a sudden a very classy well-kept neighborhood. So don't let that put you off. The rooms are a bit small as many big-city hotel rooms are. The security was impressive...you need to use your room key to enter the elevator or go up the stairs off the lobby. There is a wings/beer type restaurant downstairs off the lobby that has some pretty good daily specials. The Stanley Cup playoffs were underway while we were in town, and the Canadians do love their hockey and made a lot of noise during the games in the restaurant, so we decided to join them and had a blast watching our first hockey game over a beer with the locals. There is a common room with a cappucino machine and a microwave above the lobby, and we brought back food from some of the farmers' markets in town and made our dinner there. Everything in town is within walking distance or you take the Skytrain- there are 2 stations just a few blocks away. The accomodations are not the nicest in the world, but if you want a good value in a very convenient location, this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start for my winter vacation”
Reviews.Author: qatarflyer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay 3 days in Vancouver to get rid off my jetlag and look around the city before I travelled across BC. After arriving at the international airport, I took a taxi to get to the Howard Johnson Hotel. The place is very central and you get everything you need in the neighbourhood close by. After entering the hotel I received a very warm welcome by the lady at the reception. I wasn't quite sure, if everthing will work well after booking the hotel through the internet. But everything was arranged and prepared and all my doubts were gone. After doing the paperwork and being told where everything is, I went to my room (standard regular) and was surprised by the warm atmosphere. The room was quite big, very clean and included all necessary furniture. Especially to highlight the very comfortable bed. After preparing myself I went down to the reception, I got very useful insider tips for my evening programme. 3 days later I checked out quite early in the morning, very quick and professional, and the receptionist put the first smile of the day on my sleepy face.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, in the heart of the city. Excellent service. Highly recommed it!”
Reviews.Author: London_UK_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks. I would give an A for the excellent location. If you are looking for a hotel that is close to all amenities and night clubs, that's the place were you want to be. We got a good value for the money. The rooms were very clean and staff was very approachable and polite (as Canadians are) In overall, superb!! Job well done goes to the GM and her team!

Reviews.Title: “a great place for both, leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: dariagordeeva
Reviews.Content: Me and my colleagues travelled recently to Vancouver to build up some contacts with one of the Canadian companies. Our company's travel agent has placed us in Howard Johnson Hotel. I must say that i was very surprised in a good way for the first time in a long time. The hotel has a great location (it took us really short time to get there from the airport), offers great entertainment, in the centre of the whole @groove@, After long mornings and days of negotiations and work we could go out to explore the city.; Overall experience is great- clean, with welcoming and smiley staff, quite spacious rooms- overall a great value for money. I will definitely go back with friends of on a business trip and would not even bother checking the rest of the hotels around. Highly recommend,

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE-TOTAL DIVE”
Reviews.Author: xocassie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a dirty hostel...right from looking at the hotel you could tell it wasn't going to be a good night. We arrived to find it was at the very end of grandville...where all the homeless people and drugies are. They stood outside the hotel and right across the street. We paid 20 dollars for parking which I understand is normal for Vancouver...but usually its for under ground secure parking. This was out on the side of the building with no lights. It looked sketchy and unsafe...but what could we do we had already paid for the hotel and the parking. No one said where the parking was so when I went back out to the car I drove around the building and had to call the front desk and asked where the parking was. As soon as we checked into our room we realized what a freaking dive it was. It was so small and cramped the windows where filthy and it smelled like an old dirty rag that had been left in the sink was used to clean up. There were pipes that ran through the room that where painted. The remote didnt work for the tv. The bed was rock hard. We would have cancelled our hotel but it was non-refundable and everywhere else was booked up or was really expensive. I asked the front desk to come up when we returned from supper to smell the room because it stunk so bad. I had asked them not to go in the room till we had come back as we had left our belongings out including credit cards and other personal information. They went in anyways and just opened up a window to air the place out...when we came back the room still smelled. So we went and bought an air freshener...yes it was that bad. So we tossed and turned all night on the hard bed and got out of there first thing the next morning. I called in a complaint when we arrived home and they said they would get back to me on the 19th of may. Today was the first day anybody contacted me about my issue (may 24th). All the general manager could say was thanks for your complaint and have a good victoria day. Are you kidding me? So I proceeded to ask to speak to someone above her...she wouldnt give me a name and basically told me it was my fault our experience was bad because I didnt complain enough. Rudest costumer service I have had in my entire life...no joke! So I called the customer service line again in hopes that someone else will be able to help me. My advice? pay the extra 20 dollars and stay at the empire land mark down the street. Way nicer inside and better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a lively location”
Reviews.Author: LMB8
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the airport via Yaletown Roundhouse station on the Canada Line. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. Our first room had no hot water but this was sorted very quickly by the staff offering an alternative room. The hotel is in an area where there is lots of night life so can be noisy although this did not bother us. Of course it does mean that there is lots of choice locally for eating and drinking. The hotel has a bar which is busy during sporting events. A couple of minor points - there is a rather overpowering flowery smell throughout the public areas which we did get used to, but it could probably be offputting and the curtains in the room did not fully block out the light although a safety pin quickly remedied that! We went on a city break and wanted a clean, comfortable and safe place to sleep. This fitted the bill well and we would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the HoJo!”
Reviews.Author: drock6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very pleasant weekend stay here last week. From the moment we arrived to check in the staff were very warm and friendly and the service carried through until the end of our stay. The rooms were surprisingly modern in decor with a good colour scheme. Bathrooms a little more basic but very clean. I saw the post about the nightclub beside the hotel but my wife and I both slept fine and didn't hear any noise from the music. ?? We were on the third floor. Great overall stay and we'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle45
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a concert with my teenage daughter. This hotel is a 10 min walk to Rogers arena, or a $6 cab ride. Also a short walk to the Yaletown skytrain stn. Neighborhood is alittle rowdy with bars and nite clubs but it is downtown Vancouver. Rooms were clean but small but fine for a night. We were on the 3rd floor and didn't hear the bar below. Would reccommend this place for concerts or games. The staff are very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY”
Reviews.Author: JJ86Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located over a dance club which is not posted on the website so unless u stay on the 4th or 5th floor u will hear the music pounding. We didn't need a huge room but we did need 2 beds. After being moved to a room on the top floor, when you opened the door you hit the end of the bed and had to wiggle through the door. The only have limited parking as well which is awkward to find and to actually park.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown deal...”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: Small room but very clean...Perfect if you are in Vancouver for shopping. The staff is polite and accomodating...Would recommed it for a night or two but not for a week...

Reviews.Title: “perfect location + renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: ivona82
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days in thi hotel. I was very satisfied with the service, staff was friendly and accommodating. Rooms are not extremely large, but clean and renovated.I liked location, close to shopping center and beaches. Located in the center of the action. What me and my frieds liked the most

Reviews.Title: “** Great Surprise **”
Reviews.Author: Ivanna2010
Reviews.Content: This is third time that I visit Vancouver and the second time that I stayed at this hotel, great surprise when doing check-in, the person of the reception remembered to me, from last time i stayed and i felt very pleasant, the rooms are clean, the staff is helpful, the location in perfect if you look for to be near restaurants, shopping and all the public transportation that takes you to any part of Vancouver is close. Also really like the early check-in free of charge. I hardly recommen this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Welcoming front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Macka_11
Reviews.Content: Located on one of the main streets of downtown one can tell that this hotel is close to everything - shopping streets , crazy nightlife, Yaletown coffee shops, restaurants and bars, touristy Granville Island or nice long sea walks. The hotel staff has made us quite welcomed and presented Vancouver in the best light - although the weather was more grey than anything :( Good rooms , nice bathrooms - seemed renovated recently - well serviced too. Welcomed the Laundry service option. We've enjoyed the stay a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: jenbro85
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, 5/10 minutes walk from the centre. The rooms were okay, a bit dated but otherwise fine. At night, we did find the rooms a little stuffy. The staff were very helpful particularly when we had an issue with our car hire. Wings next door is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiemonster61
Reviews.Content: We decided to come to Vancouver and spent our holidays there with some friends who live in the city. Due to the size of their condo we had to look for the hotel. They suggested few hotels around them and this one came as highly recommended. Most of their family and friends stayed here while visiting, rooms were clean, staff friendly and profimity to our friends unbelievably close. Rooms were small, but nicely decorated, with new furniture and TV. All the front desk people were super nice, said hi and bye all the time, housekeeping staff also friendly. What I found the most amazing is, that one day I saw front desk lady eating a cookie. She apologized for having her mouth full and offered me one of her home made cookies. They were amazing!!!! She ended up giving me few more and a recipe to make them at home myself with the phone number to caqll her, if I have any problems making them. Can you believe this? I found this experience amazing! We live in the world where people dont even say hi to you in the elevator anymore and here, this woman gives me her homemade cookie! This is the personal touch that makes the difference in the world! Thank you so much for everything, we will be back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice, main floor chaos is not”
Reviews.Author: Meeshax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in November on our way home from a vacation. This is an old hotel that has been renovated. The rooms are small but nicely decorated and clean. There the good comments stop. When we checked in the front desk was very busy and chaotic, compounded by the people hanging around in the lobby who were patrons of a popular pub also in the hotel. We were assigned a room with key card only to go up and find out that the room was already occupied - there were suitcases belonging to others already in the room. So back downstairs to get assigned a different room - this time unoccupied. When we returned from a late dinner we had to run the gauntlet though a crowd of patrons from a popular dance club (also located in the hotel) who were outside on the sidewalk smoking. The whole night was topped off by being woken up twice by noisy, drunk girls going down the hallway to a room - obviously staying in downtown Vancouver to party. In summary - nice rooms, nicely renovated hotel - way too noisy and chaotic for my liking. Okay if you in town to party, I guess. For one night it was okay but would NEVER stay there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “UGLY NASTY”
Reviews.Author: fox111111
Reviews.Content: I went there the rooms too smalls, found a mouse trap behing night table, help desk agents are just in simple and clear words "HELP LESS"

Reviews.Title: “What a great place in the heart of shopping and nightlife to stay in Vancouver, BC!”
Reviews.Author: MacTravel2010
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a centrally located hotel at a reasonable price, I would recommend Howard Johnson Hotel on Grandview Street. Not only is it easy to find, but it is central to shopping, eating and night life in the upscale areas of Vancouver. It will definitely be a place we return to in the future. If the night life is not your bag, ask for a room towards the back of the hotel. Great coffee shops and restaurants close to the hotel. There is easy parking and access to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Earplugs & Noseplugs Required”
Reviews.Author: A_Denegar
Reviews.Content: After booking our hotel room through hotwire at the Ramada on Granville, we were shuttled across the street after the Ramada overbooked. The Howard Johnson on Granville is a cheap place to sleep, but that's being generous. Here's what I disliked about this place: (1) the front counter woman was indifferent if not unfriendly; people in this business need to learn to smile once every so often; (2) small room on "first" floor (actually the second floor) was small and claustrophobic and dark (time for a renovation) (3) 14" TV? Really? (4) no counter space in bathroom to speak of, unless the top of the toilet counts (5) no face clothes (washclothes) (6) filthy sink faucet (7) loose shower head (8) loose bathroom fan (9) unidentified pink stuff stuck to bathroom wall (10) course, stained and ripped bath towels (which are only slightly larger than a hand towel) (11) NOISY and SMELLY! First, the double-pained window is useless because the air conditioner unit lets all the street noise in (yes, you can hear drunken girls fighting in the streets!) as well as letting in the putrid smell of the pub's kitchen (12) NOISY. Second, it's one floor up from a nightclub called Barcelona. Did I mention that you can hear all sorts of tomfoolery outside until well after 2 AM, along with the pounding bass. So, all in all, if you bring earplugs, noseplugs, your own bath towels, and a good dose of patience, this place might do the trick. Me? I'll never go back.

Reviews.Title: “******Friendly staff , clean rooms, all we needed****”
Reviews.Author: Ivanna2010
Reviews.Content: My mon, young daughter and me stay at the Howard Johnson in downtown, the location is great, close to everything, perfect a weekend get away. The athmosfere was great, lot of people around, staff super friendly, and the rooms were decent. I was a little disappointment with the fact is pay parking, but compare with other hotels around the area with parking included still cheaper to stay at this hotel. Other than that we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: maleficum
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at HOJO downtown, when I was in Vancouver for a conference. I have nothing to complain about. The room was big and had everything, including a coffee maker, coffee mugs and free tea and coffee, which enabled me to have breakfast in the room without spending extra money! The room was cleaned daily. There was a securty lock inside on the door so I could lock myself in (and that made me feel safe being a solo female traveller). I saw some reviews complaining about noise etc.. maybe because of my rooms location I did not have that problem. It wasn't noisy and the bed was very comfy so I had no problems sleeping. There was wireless internet in the room, it was quite slow, but it was enough for checking my emails and surfing on the net. there was also a coin operated laundry machine and dryer on the floor, so doing your laundry is not a problem. Just one thing I did not like; the room was a bit dark, the lighting wasn't enough, I think they would have used higher voltage light bulbs. Overall, I had a pelasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “never stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisyd1944
Reviews.Content: if you are under thirty then this hotel may suit you the bar area is noisy with loud music and lots of youngsters having a good time , The hotel is drab with a musty odour about it ,The room we had was small and dark not very inviting it took approximately ten minutes for the water to heat up for a wash shower e,t,c and the face flannel consisted of a piece of linen to put your hand in air con i would say was out of date very noisy , The hotel seemed to be frequented by some unsavoury characters who had easy access to the lifts although they were key card operated, Walking down granville street to the hotel you had to walk a gauntlet of tramps ,beggers and others which was extremely intimidating .As regards Vancouver it has a lot to offer and we will be back but certainly not to the Howard Johnston hotel

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for your great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Lilly40
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel at the end of August. Visiting from Kelowna with our young children we spent few nights there and visited PNE . We really liked the location, parking was limited, but it was not a problem during the week, I guess it is different story during the weekend. I remember making a reservation and being told specifically about the parking charge and the fact that they don't have enough spots. Rooms are very lovely, a bit on a smaller side, but decor was bright and cheerfull. Needless to say, we did not spent much time there anyways. Noise was not a problem either. Thank you, we will be back next summer!

Reviews.Title: “At the Center of Everything”
Reviews.Author: bigsurfer13
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the Howard Johnson Hotel on Granville Street in the heart of Downtown Vancouver. We always travel with our dog "Trax" whenever possible and finding a hotel that caters to pet owners can be tricky. The HOJO seems to have taken this mission by the tail. The Brochure said pet friendly and we decided to book a three night stay. We found the staff to be super helpful to the point of offering to walk Trax for us on occasion. We found a dog park right around the corner with plenty of action to keep Trax occupied and we were three blocks from the English Bay and the Beach. Everything we wanted to do like Shopping, sightseeing and nightlife were all within a few blocks of our hotel. We had a great room with a big new flatscreen TV, although we didn't use it much and hotel staff that never missed a chance to improve our stay. We enjoyed our Visit to Vancouver very much and really enjoyed the people and ammenities of our chosen hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convinient”
Reviews.Author: KeyWie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in the middle of the summer. We did travel a lot, went to see Victoria and Whistler. Hotel had a great location, we could go and eat at many restaurants and walk to anywhere we wanted. Staff was very nice and helpful, especially lady named Gabriela, she was from Mexico, and she was very very good and helpfull. Also the housekeeping staff was very very nice, all the staff made us feel welcome! One sunny day, they all oredered ice cream, and they shared it with us! I was actually amazed at this gesture. We had a little problem with our air conditioning unit, but that was fixed right away. There was a bit of noise on the weekend, but we are used to it. Restaurant in the hotel was ok, they specialize in chicken wings, we are not fans. After our stay we went on a Alaska Cruise, and that was excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM”
Reviews.Author: Norby45
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 separate stays at the hotel. One was in August and the second stay was in September. I must say, in August we stayed at the hotel over the weekend, it was busy, noisy, but not as bad as we thought. Our stay last week was perfect, hotel was not as busy and crazy as in August. We came to the hotel that was booked throught our travel agent in Germany kind of worried, because of all the reviews, but we did not run into any problems whatsoever. Staff was very nice and helpful, parking the bus was not a problem at all, we will defintely recommend this hotel to our friends. Hotel is located in a perfect setting, we could walk everywhere. There were even 2 girls there who spoke German! Thank you for everything, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very central location - we recommend!”
Reviews.Author: moonflower_22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this particular hotel on four occasions in the past three years and have always been satisfied with the place. The staff were friendly and forthcoming, the rooms (queen size) standard, clean and with good pressured showers. In our last stay we even got an upgrade to the next size up and that room even had a sofa (for 3rd person) and was quite a bit more spacious. The laundry machine and dryer on one of the floors came in very handy too. The location is very central and easily accessible by public transport, especially now, that the new skytrain line from the airport is stopping just a couple of blocks away! If you're interested in nightlife, Granville St has several clubs, bars and restaurants. With children, you will like the close proximity of Granville Island just a short boat ride across False Creek or a walk across the bridge. We recommended the "Hojo" to friends back home and one couple stayed over a week and was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but great location”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: Beside the bad smell on our level, the room was OK with a clean bathroom and clean sheets...The location is perfect if you expect to do a little shopping...For the price we paid we can't complain...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Pohughie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in June 2010. Hotel is nothing special. Room was small but OK with a clean bed and bathroom, but the hallways and public areas looked dark, dingy and grubby. I was disappointed that no-one told us about the lounge on the first floor for coffee/internet access etc. which I didn't discover until the end of the 2nd day. Parking was charged extra and I really couldn't see why. There was a parking lot at the side of the hotel which was strewn with rubbish (and worse). Everytime we parked there, there was fresh vomit and discarded drug paraphinalia. The real problem this hotel faces is the area it's in. There are bars and nightclubs all around and the streets are dotted with homeless drop-outs and drunks. Hotel - OK , Area - The Pits

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of price and location”
Reviews.Author: chinchilla_bob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occassions, once in 2009 and then again earlier this year. I am planning another trip to Vancouver in the coming months and rest assured this hotel will be on my short list to check for availability then too! Located downtown it's a short walk to many places and the saving of 4 minutes of walking for one closer certainly doesn't warrant the prices other hotels are offering rooms out for! The hotel is, as some have mentioned, close to some bars and clubs and while I have seen other reviews on here mentioning noise coming from them I can hand on heart say I didn't experience any noise or sleep problems as a result. On a personal note I found the General Manager (I believe her name was Lucia?) extremely helpful, giving me tips on places to see, where to catch transport for a few things I wanted to see and do as well as giving me an overview of the city as a whole. As an international guest it's little things like this which make your life so much easier when in a new place and she happily spent time talking to me and other guests while it was quiet - giving it a real personal edge and the hotel as a whole a significant step up from my perception. $ for $ this really is amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy and with mice”
Reviews.Author: altyaces
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel, the first night we got 3 hours sleep due to a whistling noise from somewhere in the bathroom, and the second night after changing rooms mice chewed through a bag and ate a chocolate bar. But if you can get past these things the staff were helpful and polite and the price was reasonable and the hotel is in a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, excellent service and room quality, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: RaphaeloErding
Reviews.Content: I lived in this hotel for about 3 weeks and I was really happy about it. It is located DOWNTOWN, about 5 minutes from the sea and the same from Robson Street, the famous shopping street. The rooms are quiet, very beautiful and especially clean, that was really important for me!! However, night clubs, restaurants or other locations are just around the corner. In conclusion: great service and room quality, excellent prices, perfect location !!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap Enough to sleep with mice!!!”
Reviews.Author: cielatravels
Reviews.Content: Ok it is a definitely good value hotel but the mice? I don't think so! It is loud and crazy outside at night with so many bars outside. The only nice part is the restaurant downstairs that serve good wings! I was so scared of having a mice in my bed that i kept all my clothes on even my coat! First of all they put as in a tiny really outdated room. At first we thought it was just the beer getting to us because we have never seen a mice in a hotel before! Well this is the first! They only offered us another room, which by the way is a lot better than the other room it is slightly bigger and a bit more to date. I still don't get why we didn't get the room when we checked in (it's a lot better) and how do they know there aren't any mouse up there either? The mouse practically ran the hotel! They didn't seem surprise when we called. Sleeping was hell because of all the noises outside and even inside the hotel! You can practically hear your neighbor making love, which reminded us of Sex and the City2 which we watch the same day! It was an adventure, but next time I would be staying in a mice free zone!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: NellyC76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and found it to be a very comfortable hotel. The lobby, mezzanine and restaurant facilities were nice and possibly a little deceiving as the rooms were not quite up to the same standard. The rooms were small but comfortable enough, there was not a lot of natural light. It's a good thing I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel room. The area surrounding the hotel is questionable, as a female I certainly wouldn't have walked around there alone at night. But it was a nice short walk into downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Really central, great price, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Hammyclaire
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want somewhere central downtown in Vancouver. It is really good value for money compared to anywhere else in the Granville area and the bar downstairs (Wings) has a vibrant atmosphere with friendly staff and brilliant food/bar offers. We had a room facing away from the front which meant you couldn't hear any of the noise late at night, but the walls are thin so beware noisy neighbours! Amenities are of a good standard, rooms are small but cosy and decor is decent. Free WiFi throughout the building. Only problem we had was a leaky air conditioning unit which meant a wet patch on the carpet - housekeeping helped as much as they could and the staff offered us a room change but we were settled so left a towel on the floor for the couple of days we were there! Also worth noting you need a room card to access the lifts so very secure. Overall no frills room but clean and comfortable which is all we needed - can't complain for such a good price.

Reviews.Title: “good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: wasklywabbit
Reviews.Content: I was returning from Puerto Vallarta Mexico and needed a place because of a late flight. I chose the Hojo because of it's cheap price right after the Winter Olympics $69 per night plus tax. It is a 15 minute walk down Granville from the downtown Canada Line exit or same from Yaletown exit. It was 130 am when I checked in and the hotel was quiet. The bed was good and coffee shops are right across the street. If you are in Vancouver for the nightlife it would be a great place as it is on Granville. I will probably stay there again. Older building but well kept up. Restaurant / bar on premise , no breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: newyorkSK
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Close to everything, good restaurant for breakfast next door.

Reviews.Title: “good room at a good price, in an convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: follome
Reviews.Content: at $59 a night, I could not pass this up, considering its in downtown Vancouver and withing walking distance to cross over to Granville Island!...the room was small but freshly painted and clean, the bathroom very clean and roomy and bright. This is an older hotel yes, but it appears to be well kept...the front desk staff was very helpful with giving me transportation directions every day. Overall a good experience...including dinner at Wings in the hotel...only drawback was the nightclub this hotel is attached to. I could hear the music from my room, but not disturbing enough not to be able to sleep...again overall I would stay here again for the right price!...and the free wireless internet in the room wasa great bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel / friendly staff / in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bavarian100
Reviews.Content: Just a nice Hotel in a pefect location . Very friendly and helpful staff . You get a lot for your money . Rooms very clean and comfortable . I stayed already at this Hotel and I will go there again .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, avergage hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WLG
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying here after reading other reviews but the location and price was too good so I gave it a go. Overall I had no problems with the staff and found them to be pleasant and helpful at all times. The room was average and dated (had a slight musty smell) but was clean and a decent size. I stayed Sun - Weds so it was very quite as the downstairs bar closed early. The location is fantastic and overall it was good basic accommodation if your standards are not too high. The food in the bar is great. The main problem was the elevator kept breaking which was a hassle taking suitcases up stairs, also the street itself is a bit dodgy - nothing too scary but a bit unpleasant at night if you are are a single female.

Reviews.Title: “is cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: l_everett04
Reviews.Content: the size for the room was ok but there was an awful smell of sewage in the corridor and on the last night i was awoken by a rodent. The area was a bit rough too

Reviews.Title: “if u want any sleep dont stay here1”
Reviews.Author: specialshelley
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent one night here before flying home and it was a terrible hotel. it was booked through last minute.com and on the site it said nothing about a night club in the hotel which plays extremely loud music until 2am and the hotel is full of very loud drunk people. i specified when booking that i was 7 months pregnant and asked it if was possible for a quiet room but i dont think there is such thing. my husband complained and asked if we could be moved somewhere quieter as we had to be up very early for out flight and they said no. the walls were paper thin the staff were not very friendly or helpful, the TV didnt work properly, the room was not very clean or nice the area was not very nice and had nothing close by. i complained to last minuite.com 3 weeks ago and still have had no response and complained to howard johnson who emailed back saying the hotel manager will get back to us within 2 weeks and it has now been 3 weeks and i have heard nothing so they obviously dont care about complaints either. i would strongly recommend avoiding this hotel at all costs, i travelled around canada with my husband for 3 weeks staying in different hotels every night and this is the only hotel and booking site that i have a bad word to say about.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: turnmills_nz
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short. We paid $276 for the HOJO Granville Vancouver experience. This hotel is a rundown place with little or no customer service. He had issues with car break-ins, lifts not working, a small cramped and stuffy room with virtually no natural light, air conditioners that made so much noise you could not use them. On top of this, 'customer service' is a misnomer. I have never experienced such off-hand dealing with the customer experience than I did at this place. Any complaints (and there were plenty) were dealt with arrogance and a total lack of empathy (including our car breakin in the hotel carpark). Never again. Just don't do it. Oh. Our formal complaint with the Howard Johnson was completely ignored. When we followed up on it a week later our suspicion was that it had either been deleted or never logged in the first place (we had a complaint number). What I write is only a part of it. It is rundown, over-priced with an atmosphere that drips with apathy. Without doubt the worst hotel I have stayed in $$ wise and experience wise.

Reviews.Title: “crap”
Reviews.Author: pokiegeelong
Reviews.Content: too noisy poor service..walls must be paper thin..and noise from street means no sleep at night...windows dirty...expensive for the type of room which was small...hotel in middle of reconstructing on the outside...street is dirty and is a awash with cigarete butts which one has to walk through...

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bit_Chick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while attending the ACDC concert. Although the rooms were small, they were clean. Great wings & things bar attached to the hotel. Granville Street is a busy and loud street and under alot of construction for the Olympics, so don't plan on getting too much sleep. Walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Will the car still be there tomorrow?”
Reviews.Author: StuartSussex
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson hotel is on the main street - Granville Street in a fairly central part of Vancouver between Downtown and Granville Island. The thing that hit me when arriving was that its not exactly the best area of town. Lots of seedy adult shops, people hanging round and a general feel of danger. I think danger was largely unfounded, but it seems to get even worse on the evening. Surprisingly, our car survived 2 days in the car park intact, being (I think) in the same place when we returned to where we left it. Once past reception, the rooms were fairly good (expectation is low at this point). Clean & reasonable, and surprisingly again quiet on the evening with nobody knocking on your door at midnight. There is a card system that prevents oursiders from wandering in beyond the lobby (unless they tailgate). Hence, I thought these were good rooms for the price, but stay somewhere else if you want to step out on your own in the evening or if you drive in using your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Average... very average.”
Reviews.Author: Ashmnoah
Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get. I got a great deal because it was off season- April. Rate was 59 CAD on Thursday night and 69 CAD on Friday night. It was a great location, staff was helpful and friendly. Close to walk to Granville Island, Gastown, Robson St, the works! Parking was eary and fairly inexpensive (14CAD/night) but it was outdoor and felt unsafe but no problems while I was there! Worst part was the cleanliness. My room had a hair in the shower, one on the bathroom floor and one in the sheets. YUCKO! The room was small but had what you needed: bathroom, desk, TV and bed. I would probably not stay there again but the perk is the LOCATION! Its inexpensive and right in the heart of everything. You can walk anywhere from that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but there's room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperAB
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hojo. The location is great--very central--although parts of Granville are gritty. Overall, this hotel provides good value for money, at least during the low season. However, I was disappointed with the level of customer service during this visit and some aspects of the room. For example, I could not access pay-per-view movies on my TV and although I was told the matter was being looked into, the problem was never resolved. I also had to phone to get updates on the situation rather than staff following up with me. In addition, after my trip, I found out that I could have collected Aeroplan points for my stay had I enrolled in the Wyndham program (which I could have done at the hotel), but the staff did not inform me of this opportunity. I would have appreciated a heads up on this or a sign saying that the stay could qualify for Aeroplan points. I cannot get these points credited even though I am an Aeroplan member because I had not enrolled in the Wyndham program. In terms of the room, you could hear the bass from a nearby club well into the early morning on Fri and Sat, and since it was not coming in through the windows, all I could do was sleep with earplugs. I also found the mattress I was sleeping on to be very soft and uncomfortable. Finally, the hotel uses strong smelling cleaning products to which I had an allergic reaction (stuffy nose, headache). I would still recommend this hotel, but caution that you may not get a very good night's sleep on weekends and staff are friendly, but a bit passive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, very very noisy”
Reviews.Author: lala85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Vancouver Marathon 2007. Having spent a lot of time in Vancouver during University, I knew the area was a bit seedy, so it didn't bother me in the least. This isn't an area to be afraid of- just not great to look at. The hotel seemed very secure and I never questioned our safety. Initially we were given a very small room with two double beds on the first floor. The pounding bass from the nightclub below was very loud and kept us awake. We requested to be moved to a different floor the next day, and management was very accommodating. Our second room was on the top floor of the hotel- much larger with a very nice tiled bathroom. We still experienced a tremendous amount of street noise and nightclub noise in the evening (sucks when you're getting up at 5am to run a marathon). All in all, not a bad hotel- if you plan to stay here, bring earplugs. It also wouldn't hurt to request a room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Ansolutely terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: concerttraveler25
Reviews.Content: The only good thing this hotel has to offer is the location... the rooms are gross, the value is nothing to brag about and the customer service may have been the worst I've ever seen. The general manager was rude, sarcastic and unprofessional. I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Toad_of_Toad_Hall
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, decor maybe a little worn, not spectacular amenities. But it's clean, well maintained, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Great value for the moderate price! Thanks to the staff, who went out of their way to give us an early check in, when we arrived burnt out from an overnight flight. Granville Street was being torn up, that made arrival and departure with heavy luggage a bit of a hassle. Because of the construction, it was a little hard to get a cab to come very early in the morning to go back to the airport. We noticed a small monetary exchange between driver and desk clerk when someone finally did come.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, average location.”
Reviews.Author: DandD2319
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself was clean (and the bar below had great food!) and the staff were ok at local knowledge and stored bags for free, the location of the hotel at present (the area/street is being upgraded at present) is in a bit of a crappy area. There is a bus that can easily take you to Stanley Park, but not so easily down to the main shopping & tourist strips and it's a bit of a hike. Granville Street is beautiful at the end closest to the water, but as you move further inland, it is filled with sex shops, closed businesses, nightclubs and homeless in doorways. Ok as young singles but would not recommend hotel in this location to older persons nor those with families as it can be a bit overwhelming. Try staying a few blocks closer to the water if you want a more enjoyable 'ambience' of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: happyboredom
Reviews.Content: I was at the HoJo for New Year's Eve. This is a good place to stay for New Year's Eve but I wouldn't come here for any other reason than to party. The upside: the staff is courteous and helpful. The Lobby looks nice and clean. Parking is nearby but not included in the price. The location is convenient to bars and clubs. The downside: the rooms are claustrophic and the place smelled kind of funny. Conclusion: Since it was New Years there were lots of young partygoers. Come here if you want to party and be near the bars and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in my favorite area of vancouver”
Reviews.Author: saxmanNelson
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel as my "home" of choice every single time I come to Vancouver (I'm from the Kootenays), whether on business or pleasure. The best thing about it is the location. It is within walking distance of EVERYTHING ...Yaletown, BC Place, GM Place, the Orpheum, the Vogue, great restaurants and numerous nightclubs ....etc. I love the fact that it is an older hotel that has been significantly restored. What comes with that is a small hotel feel and a bit of charm that an older heritage building holds. I have taken to talking to people during every trip - in the lobby, at the desk, in the restaurant and in the elevator. I am always astounded at the number of people from all over the world ...and I find that very appealing. I have always received courteous service from the staff and if I ever have a concern, it is dealt with immediately. I wasn't fond of my first room on my last trip and, without question, they gave me a new room which was actually larger and nicer ....for no extra charge. The manager is bouyant and charismatic and always asks me about my day and is genuinely concerned about my satisfaction ...I find that very comforting. To be honest, I have never ever considered looking into another hotel because I have always felt that the Howard Johnson is my home while in Vancouver. Kudos to the staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “prefect!!!”
Reviews.Author: canada1000
Reviews.Content: I and my husband were in the seventh heaven at this hotel. We were very satisfied every services.Hotel was very clean, staff were very freindly and the location was great! It was very easy to go to the sightseeing spots. We could have a long talk about sightseeeing routs with staffs and they suggested many things, moreover, they willingly booked the one day tour for us. They were very polite for us, of course, for other guests. One of our favorite point in this hotel is all of staffs were hard-working!! Always they thought about guests and they were trying hard to make a good hotel in Vancouver. We could understand their feelings. We think this hotel is marvelous in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: mberta
Reviews.Content: Complaint Description: My car was towed from the hotel parking lot where I paid 12$ to the hotel to park the car overnight as I was a hotel guest. The hotel had my lisense plate on file and had my bill showing that I paid for parking on file and should not have authorized my car to be towed. The employee told me that the cars are towed if the parking pass is not displayed on the dash. I left it on the dash. The hotel refunded my 12$ (which I consider to be an admittance of wrong doing). If the hotel knowingly authorized my car to be towed then it is safe to assume that the hotel has a business revennue sharing deal to tow the cars of it's customers. The hotel employee and on duty manager aruged that if the parking pass was not displayed on the dash then the car would be towed and would not budge from that position. I maintain that pass could have been moved by the towing company when they towed my car. They had to enter the car to release the e-break so they totally could have moved it. It is in the towing companies financial interest to lie and say I didn't have a pass or it wasn't in the correct location. The hotel even called the impound lot who claimed to walk to the car and said the pass wasn't in plain site. When I was at the impound lot I later learned that they phone wasn't a cell or cordless phone and She wasn't even checking my car. She was lying to me from a phone in the office that could not see the inside of my car from. I took a cab to the inmpound lot. The cab driver told me that he takes people every day from my hotel to the same impound and hears my story all the time. He also thinks that the hotel has a deal with the tow trunk company. There was another customer in the hotel that was complaining about this issue at the same time as me! They did it to two people on the same day! I got to the impound lot and paid about 100$ to get the car out. When I entered the car I noticed that the parking pass was in the center of the car near the stick shift and e-brake. There is no way that they could have released the e-brake without seeing the pass!! I maintain that I left it on the dash and the towing company moved it because they make money off of towing others people's cares and then charging them to get it back. I then drove back to the hotel to try to get a refund. They would not refund my money or give me any kind of break because they said the pass was not on the dash. Then I noted on the parking pass that it doesn't even say that it has to be displayed on the dash!! They still wouldn't refund my money. They said that a small sign in the parking lot said it had to be on the dash. I pulled in to the lot when it was dark and didn't see the sign because it is not in a well lite area. But that doesn't matter because I left my pass on the dash anyway and it was likely moved by the towing agency. The hotel manager even accused me of parking on the street rather than in her lot! I have the reciepts from the hotel, the towing company, and the parking pass I can fax into the BBB. When I left I accused the employee of having a sweatheart deal with the toe drunk company and he said, "Yeah we do. I get half or even more depending on how mad i can make you". These people will scam and rip you off with a smile. Stay away! Not only that but another customer was complaining about being overcharged while another customer said she got stuck in the elevator!! Stay away from this hotel at all costs!! I had to file a complain with the Canadian BBB

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BelgianCousine
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience staying there. Problems with the check-in, very unhelpful staff, a very bad smell all over, the airco was like 30 yrs old and didn't cool, the bathroom and the room itself were very small, and last but not least: you can hear EVERYTHING that happens in the rooms nextdoor!! Really a terrible experience, by far the worst in our 16-day stay in Canada...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Howard Johnson”
Reviews.Author: EdMun
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time at this Hotel in Downtown Vancouver , the staff are excellent and cannot do enough to help, definately stay again. The Manager is very helpful and also works on reception whenever needed, EXCELLENT !!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bundyco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled by train from Toronto to Vancouver and stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. We had a wonderful stay. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was spotless and we quickly became friendly with the cleaning staff. We could not have asked for a more friendly bunch of people. You are only about 2 blocks from the high-end shops and streets. For the good value we got, we certainly didn't mind walking for 3 minutes. A washer and dryer were also available for travellers which was absolutely wonderful. The other hotels that were right in the same area (within half a block) were priced at sometimes double and more for what we got at this hotel. I was actually surprised when I saw that they were right on the same block and twice as much money. We definitely will go back and are planning our next trip for 2009. The room was so nice that we are going to ask for the same one again. Bravo to the hotel and cleaning staff for making our vacation so nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: godomica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our two teenage daughters for 3 nights. The rooms were clean and newly remodeled. I would recommend this hotel for those who want to stay downtown on a budget. Neighborhood was a bit noisy at night because of night club district close by, but we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: RavTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is both good & bad. The good is it really is in Vancouver's city center, so everything in the city is close at hand. The bad is that this part of Granville St. is seedy, with a lot of sketchy people wandering around. Hotel parking is limited and not supervised. The price seemed fair for a downtown hotel. The hotel staff were not particularly friendly when I made our reservation, nor when we checked in. We had reserved a dog-friendly room. At check-in I was asked to sign the usual paperwork for having a pet. The paper stated that I would provide a kennel for my dog. I told the desk that I did not have a kennel and was not told of this requirement when I made the reservation. They did not have a kennel either, and they did not make a big deal of the requirement. Our dog-friendly room was on the first floor above a restaurant/nightclub and a construction site in the middle of Granville St. The room itself was adequate, but if we had not had industrial-grade earplugs it would have been a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellots1256
Reviews.Content: Two words.....BED BUGS!!!! My sister and I stayed one night at this hotel while on an overnight business trip to Vancouver. We were disappointed in the overall appearance of the hotel and the front desk staff were not helpful. The morning after, I discovered small red bumps on my arms, back, and buttox. During the day they continued to swell and the next day, they were the size of a loonie with pussy centers. I go off to the doctor, who sends me to a dermatologist, who diagnoses the painful, itchy swelling as an allergic reaction to BED BUG BITES. Disgusting.. I have a call into the hotel manager who has not yet called me back and front end staff were not helpful on the phone. So save yourself time off work, expensive medications, and body pain and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Irishlam
Reviews.Content: For the money the hotel isn't bad, but don't expect much. The people working the front desk were not very friendly or helpful. The parking lot for the hotel was full when we checked in at 5pm. The person checking us in gave us no other options for parking, but we overheard another employee talking to another guest advise them of a nearby city lot. This was $16 for 24 hours. The room was very small. Not much bigger than a large closet. On the plus side it was clean. There was quite a bit of noise from people coming and going until about 2:30am. The bed was not very comfortable. We thought breakfast was included (this may or may not have been my error), and other guests did have a voucher for breakfast, but we found out that if the room is booked through a site such as Expedia or Travelocity it is not included. In general, I think there are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit many more to come”
Reviews.Author: peter84
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Howard Johnson in downtown vancouver. Upon arrival I checked into a room with 1 double bed for $59 plus tax. My room was on the 1st floor near the elevator and heard no noise. My room was well equipped with tv, wireless internet, phone, desk and lamps. Room and Bathroom was very clean and bed very comfortable. The location is on the southern part of downtown and a short walk to Granville Island Ferries, bars and restaurants on granville as well as short walk to anywhere in downtown. Staff are extremely freindly and in off season rate includes a full breakfast in the restaurant. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well priced”
Reviews.Author: Aradia76
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at this hotel. I have never had problems with noise there personally, but it likely depends on the night of the week that you are staying. If you are looking for a hotel in the downtown core where you can easily walk to everything, then it's a good choice. The hotel itself is nice, and the staff are very helpful. The neighborhood isn't great, but I have never felt unsafe walking to or from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: amitmk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in the last week of Sep. Awesome location at a great price. Points any tourist would love to have knowledge about before booking a hotel... 1. Location - Extremely convenient right in the center of the downtown area. Bus stop right below the hotel. Train station about 10-15 mins walk from hotel. You could go by bus too. Also, there are many restaurants in the vicinity. The pizza joint bang opposite the hotel was particularly good. You even have Burger King, McDonalds, Subway and a few cheap Chinese restaurants closeby. Most of them are open till atleast 1 am and even later on weekends. It costs abt CAD 25-30 to reach the hotel from the airport. 2. Rooms - Kind of small. But still good. Clean room and clean bathroom with hot water available 24/7. The windows open only at the top and if the AC is not on it can get very stuffy. The rooms facing the roadside are very noisy coz of the club/pub on the ground floor of the hotel. Many a time my sleep was disturbed due to the noise coming from below. Tip: Request for rooms away from roadside. 3. Front office staff - Some of them were good but some were extremely curt. 4. Car Rentals - Hertz and Avis are located closeby. Book on the net to get the best deals. Inspite of the negatives I would stil recommend this hotel due to its awesome location and price. But don't make an international call from your room. I was charged 15 CAD for a 2 min call to India. Would advise you to buy a long distance calling card from the supermarkets closeby and call whoever you want from the public phones.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: amywhitworth
