Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I didn't sleep much. The hotel was very noisy: we had constant noise from the disco downstairs, people shouting in the corridor and various pipes and so on. The location was also quite sleazy. For the money I really think we could have found something better.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a wide bearth”
Reviews.Content: The last thing you should do is stay in this hotel. On arrival with our group there were people spilling out of the bar into the lobby, drunks and beggars in the street. You have to use your room key to access the lifts and stairs for security. The rooms are small and the air condioning units very noisy. The corridors are extremely hot. There are 3 night clubs in close proximity, two acroos the street and one adjoining the hotel. The noise from the people going in and out is atrocious. The staff are struggling to cope, and unfortunately for them, failing!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: StapletonSteve
Reviews.Content: A mixed bag this place. Much has been said in previous reviews about the location which to be honest I didn't find all that bad. If you walk down Granville toward downtown you will pass 3 or 4 sex shops, peep show places etc. but no more than that and no worse than may other European cities I have stayed in. It didn't really feel that seedy and didn't bother me. There are beggars and homeless about and slightly more perhaps that I have usually come across in other major cities. Location wise it is pretty good for Vancouver. You can walk downtown, walk to the Granville Island ferry, walk down to the sea walk. It is a 5 minute walk to Yaletown where there are plenty of good restaurants, bars & coffee shops. The hotel itself is quite different. This is not a 3 or 4 star hotel. It is a cheap hotel despite it's room rates. The lobby and reception are smart enough and to be fair the decor generally was in good condition and clean although everywhere is painted a disgusting colour. Before you take your bags up to your room go and have a look because there is probably about a 80% chance you will want to move. My first room was tiny and very noisy, there was a loud mechanical noise in the room which came from somewhere deep within the building. They changed me no problem to a bigger room but did say that they tend to give the smaller rooms to overnighters, so watch out for that one. Also, some of the rooms have exposed pipework running around the walls and ceilings which isn't too attractive The real problem with this place is the noise. On the ground floor of the hotel in the middle is the lobby and on one side is a bar and on the other is a night club. If you get a room near the front then don't plan on getting any sleep until 4 maybe 5 in the morning. The noise is pretty constant and it is VERY noisy with people queuing under the hotel for the club and then falling out of it screaming and shouting. The walls of the rooms are paper thin and there is a lot of noise from corridors and showers being used and toilets flushing elsewhere. The windows in the rooms are very small and all have air con units which allow outside noise in and are nosiy when in operation. I stayed as part of a group and everyone either changed room or complained about the noise.One person had water running down their bathroom wall. But I will leave the last word to a member of staff I spoke to in a lift who told me that "I have never worked in a hotel that has had so many complaints"

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: susiebee2002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked three nights in this hotel because the price was better than others in the 3 star category, but believe me this is no 3 star hotel! Very seedy.. for the first time ever, we cancelled the 2nd and 3rd nights and moved elsewhere. It's no bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: csmyu
Reviews.Content: This place is a total crap hole. They claimed that they've just been renovated but all they really did was just a cheap face lift to cover up the inner structure issues, which you will soon discover when you step foot into the room. I've never had a worst experience even staying at a low quality motel. It's located in the middle of the ghetto within a dirty and dangeous neighborhood. To get to the parking lot you'll have to drive in from the back alley where we saw a prostitute shaving her legs with the puddle of water on the ground. The parking lot is so small there's only one way in, you'll have to back up your car in order to get out. The lobby and reception desk is relatively well docorated and vested with a sweet orange scent but don't let that first look fool you. The only request that we had with our room was for it to be non-smoking, little did we know it also came with a view of three huge power transformers outside of our one and only small window. The fire sprinkle pipes were exposed hanging down from the ceiling. The mattress was such low quality, little weight on one side will tilt the other side up. The bathroom was really small and shower water switches from cold to boiling hot every 5 secs. The shampoo provided doesn't foam up and it smelled just like the strong sweet orange scent from the lobby. My finace and I were only staying there for one night so we were trying to be tolerent and not let it spoil our last day trip in Vancouver. We tried to get rested up to fly out the next day but we were waken at 6am by a strong sufficating cigarette smoke. We checked the hallway and the window but no source of smoke there, it's only in our room that we could smell the smoke. Just when we thought we were being too sensitive, we walked into the bathroom and realized the smoke smell was actually coming down from the exhaust fan! How on earth is that possible?! It was so bad that it filled the bathroom and spilled into the room. We could no longer go back to sleep so we went downstairs to get our complimentary breakfast. We didn't have hopes for anything well, just wanted to get away from our filthy room. The breakfast came with either Tea or Coffee, white or wheat toast, sunny side up eggs or scrambled, and hashbrowns. I ordered tea, wheat toast and scrambled egg, my fiance asked for coffee, white toast and sunny side up. When our tea and coffee came, the obsurdly rude waitress told us and I quote "You'll have to share the spoon." She put down one spoon, turned and left without any explanation. I could understand that they could run out of spoons but she could at least provide us a fork, a straw, or even a knife for christ's sake!! Howard Johnson at Granville in Vancouver is absolutely the ultimate worst hotel I've stayed at. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: dispic1
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel back in october and found it to be not that bad. some of the reviews on here make it out to be in a location that is like a vice area. if you are put off by peep shows then yes there are a couple across the road, and there are some beggars dotted around, but there are beggars in nottingham where i live and probably just like any other big city!!! however i digress, if you turn left at the front of the hotel and walk around the corner the street you are on is nothing like granville street at all. you will just have to trust me on this, but i made the mistake of thinking this hotel was in an awful location, but is not that bad. the rooms were a ok and quite clean, but do ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you are concerned about noise. all in all this hotel for a stay in vancouver is ok. dont be put off by all the negative reviews. please take into consideration that all major cities have beggars, it just seems that some people have seen afew loitering around this one. ignore them or be plite and say no.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in a slightly dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: smudg0r
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean, decent included breakfast at the attached Wings restaurant and excellent value for money. It's only drawback really is the area in which it is situated - lots of "peep show" type places around and the location is generally rather seedy and well populated by suspiciously well dressed beggars. That said however, we didn't ever feel threatened at any time day or night. Wouldn't stay here with children or as a single female, but for everyone else it's just fine. Helpful staff and a decent sized room at the rear of the hotel made our 3 night stay here very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Not an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: flee4470
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was comfortable enough although the room was quite small and the water wasn't particularly hot. My main concern was the area in which the hotel is situated. There are quite a number of x-rated venues around the hotel - not the ideal area for a family or a woman on her own to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub under our room!”
Reviews.Author: kellyandmatt
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel i have ever stayed at and i hope that no one has to put up with the same horrible experience that we had to endure. My husband and I are easy going and dont let much bother us, but this hotel... it was something else! As we walked to our hotel from where our bus driver dropped us off (he didnt want to drive down Granville Street, that should have been our first clue!) we noticed many 20 cent peep shows on the other side of the road, there were people selling crack and trying to entice us with gambling on the street. As I said we are easy going, we just carried on walking, that didnt bother us to much. We found our hotel and checked in. The room was tiny and dirty, the bathroom was nice. We could hear the music from downstairs in our room from about 2pm. The music got louder until the walls were visably vibrating and there was ripples in my glass of water on the night stand. We put in our earplugs but no way could we sleep. We went down to reception and enquired about the noise (11pm) they said that "it was the nightclub who leased the floor below the hotel rooms, we were in the quietest room, they were fully booked and there was nothing they could do about it" they then turned away from us and ignored us until we left. The music turned off at arouns 5am and we got a few hours sleep. People were also climbing in the fire escape next to our room all night to visit rooms on our floor, they stayed an hour and then left, if you remember the peep shows down the road you can work out what was going on. We were supposed to stay 3 nights but checked out early. The management apologised and said that the night staff should have asked them to turn the music off. They were however not surprised that we were leaving. Terrible for a chain hotel with an otherwise good reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy location”
Reviews.Author: SamThompson
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport after a long haul flight and were greeted by friendly, welcoming staff. The room was small and a little dark with a view over a back alley way and some power cables. The aircon unit was noisy and set the a window which ment it was ineffective at night-time because it was covered by curtains Essentially the hotel has few amenities but there is a bar/restaurant next door and there are lots of shops and restaurants within a short walking distance. My main dislike was the site of the hotel on a part of Granville Street given over to sex shops. Vancouver seems to have a general problem with beggars and substance abusers but they seem to concentrate in that part of town. Towards the end of our three-night stay I was getting a little tired of running a gauntlet of deadbeats to get to get back to the hotel. Locals may take this kind of thing in their stride but for outsiders it can be a little disconcerting. Seeing a spaced out kid in our corridor one evening trying room doors with a card key did not help ease my concerns. Overall the hotel has friendly staff and clean rooms but an in-room safe would have made staying there a little less worrying. It is a budget hotel and pretends to be nothing else and offers decent value for money. Although in a seedy part of town, it is only a couple of minutes walk from much better surroundings. I would recommend it for budget travellers or those enjoying the local nightlife. It is not for those with young families, single women or the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place for a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: kish
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the Home office suite. It was equiped with microwave, fridge, coffee maker, sitting area, king size bed. The bathroom was very small and the room very, very dark. There were two small windows overlooking an alley. The second night we were woken up by loud music playing which continued until around 1.30 a.m. On checking out I asked where the music came from and was told our room was over the bar next door. I think we should have been warned about this on check-in as they must have had comments about the noise before.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Mitch&Ove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Howard Johnson for 4 nights at the start of our trip and for 2 nights before we flew home. Once you're through the door, the hotel is great for the price. The hotel lobby is quite smart and our room was good. However, it is on a street full of 'iffy' shops & bars, which made for great people-watching but would make me think twice about staying there again if I was travelling with children. We ate a couple of times in the bar attached to the hotel - 'Wings' - which served lovely food. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel, as I imagine it would be noisy if you had a room looking onto Granville Street or above the attached club & bar. We had a room at the back & it was really quiet. Good location for Granville Island, downtown etc, although everywhere was pretty accessible as the hotel is on a main bus route, and the airport shuttle bus stops dead opposite. Would stay there again - good value & a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: This was a really great price in the middle of July right in downtown Vancouver. Probably not the best spot if you have kids just because Granville St. is full of bars, and alternative shops. But this doesn't mean it's an unsafe area! If you're a young or easy-going person Granville street could be just the kind of wild, unique part of Vancouver you want to see. We stayed here during the fireworks competition and found it very handy to the beaches at English Bay. The staff was friendly enough and the air conditioner worked well (thank god, there was a heat wave that week). The walls were a bit thin and it was a bit noisy at night but we never actually had a hard time falling asleep. We'll definately stay here again because the price is so good. Don't try to walk to Granville Island unless you have to. It will take much longer than it's worth and you'll feel like you're going to be blown off the bridge or hit by a car.

Reviews.Title: “Cool reliev”
Reviews.Author: TheFranci
Reviews.Content: While staying in Vancouver, we managed to hit during an extended heat wave. We were baking in the hotel we had booked so we made a last-minute change and moved to the HoJo downtown ($135 CDN per nite). We could not have been happier to discover the newly remodeled rooms have air conditioning - somewhat of a rarity in this town, missing at even many of the $300 or $400 a night hotels. When we got in our room, we got a call from the front desk asking if everything was fine, which was a nice change from the hotel we had just checked out of. The location is convenient in the heart of downtown and many restaurants, pubs and the entertainment district are within two blocks.

Reviews.Title: “the best on Granville and for the fireworks”
Reviews.Author: sureshjohn
Reviews.Content: Was in Vancouver to see the Fireworks which was an awesome event. Surprised by this lovely hotel on the happening Granville street. Great rooms, friendly staff and most of all the convenience to downtown and shopping. The wild fire restaraunt and Crush night spots where great and so were the other adjoining night clubs. Love to go back there anyday and thanks to Trip advisor for locating this hotel

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: adnam
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel was clean, the service received by some of the staff was dispicable. I am from the Uk and during my 3 week stay in British Columbia, this was the only establishment, including other hotels, restaurants and speaking to locals that I encountered rudeness beyond belief. The manager and a receptionist called Pam were very insulting to my partner and I and were unwilling to deal with our genuine concerns regarding the room - it was overlooked, toilet broken and no wireless internet. They did not return our calls,interupted us whilst we were eating and became very agressive towards us when we asked for our concerns to be dealt with. The manager is somehow 'never around' when you want him to be and no one else is allowed to make minor decisions when he is not there, thus causing many problems. I urge you not to stay in this hotel and would reccomend that you pay a little more to stay somewhere more welcoming and provide the service you have paid for. We paid $140 per night and stayed for 9 nights and even this length of stay did not warrant any consideration, appreciation or good customer service from the manager. The hotel has no restaurant, the wireless is only available in rooms near the electrical room and the manager will be rude and insulting to you if you question him. I had to use the internet in the lobby and on three occasions he asked me why I was not using it in my room. When i said that there was no connection on all three occasions he said that no one had said this before. However, the busboy and Richard the receptionist had told us that the internet had never worked in those rooms. Lies from the manager...Its not worth staying here honestly.Go somewhere else. You pay good money for your holidays/vacation, so dont let some incompetent, aggressive unable manager make your stay in glorious Vancouver a negative experience. Positives: the beach, Stanley Park and Davie Street for its vibrant character. Go to Sandman restaurant on Granville sland for a fantastic seafood meal. Its a wonderful city, so enjoy it...just not in the Howard Johnson.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Howard Johnson's!”
Reviews.Author: winepourer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Howard Jojnson's in Vancouver BC. The room was small but extremely clean and neat. We were out exploring this beautiful city so the size did not matter to us. The front desk was very helpful when asked for information about the city and helped in getting us an early morning cab. "Wings", right next door, was a good place to eat breakfast. The food was good, the service a little slow. We took several tours (Land/Sea Tours) and we were picked up right in front of the hotel. The hotel is within walking district of the Davie area and a little farther walk to English Bay. Here there were many good restaurants and lots to see. We had a wonderful meal at "Stephos", a Greek restaurant nearby The only drawback was the nightlife noise. All in all it was a good place to stay while visiting this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Not Pet Friendly, As They Claim To Be”
Reviews.Author: BC-Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I contacted this hotel directly, after seeing them listed on a specific 'pet friendly' website. On their own site they claim to be pet friendly too. However, when I called to try to make a reservation for 4 adults, (my folks are coming over from England to visit, and I live in Victoria, so I'm going to meet them in Vancouver and bring them back to the island), and my dog I was told that I could only book a smoking suite. I said that none of us smoke, including the dog, but apparently dog's are only allowed in smoking suites - I find that completely offensive, and also completely non-dog friendly. My dog is less anti-social than many smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vard2006
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend trip to Vancouver through Expedia and this was the best value for the location that we wanted. Had an easy time taking the city bus to the hotel (stop is only a block away). Friendly front desk staff. Interior looked recently redone and was nice. Our room was on the fourth floor towards the back of the hotel. Small room, but nice and clean - had all the amenities that we needed. Location was wonderful - we walked everywhere and I felt it was very central...short walk to Granville ferry, Yaletown, Gastown, Robson Street. My only complaint was the nightclub that is on the first floor. It played LOUD music until 2 in the morning. Didn't bother us too much, but would probably bother most people, especially with small kids. If you're looking for a cool lounge for a drink at night I recommend 'Ginger 62' which is just one block down across the street. Also, the bar/restaurant in the lobby of the hotel ('Wings") was delicious! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable cleanliness, but disgraceful service”
Reviews.Author: RD123
Reviews.Content: I came to Vancouver for a conference followed by a short holiday with my partner and stayed in this hotel for the first week. It is reasonably clean and tidy, but without dining facilities. I had to move room when I arrived because my window was overlooked by from about 6ft away by another block office; this is how close some the rooms were. However, the worst problem was the hotel manager who was has rude and ignorant beyond imagination. He refused to return my calls, and generally made himself unavailable. We did not have the promised wireless internet access in my room as promised, which meant I could not work effectively, and we could not research and plan the rest of our stay as we would have liked. The manager claimed it was because we had a corner room.7 days into my 9 day stay we eventually got moved to a room that did have wireless nternet access, but when I confronted him with the fact he accused both me and partner lying about the lack of internet access, and became aggressive, accusing me of not being able to speak English (I am English, born and bred!). Also, do not believe the price promise and book your stay online. They promise the best prices are on their website, but my colleague got a 40% reduction off the advertised price when he booked a week or so before. Really, I would advise against staying here, primarily because of the Manager, (not English, you might note). While it is reasonably clean, you will not got any problems and service issues addressed satisfactorily. There is also no dining and the hotel is a seedy area, with homeless camped outside the hotel and peep shows across the street. Definately dont stay here if you are a lady travelling alone, but you might be ok if you dont expect good service and like looking at tramps and peepshows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Housekeeping, Poor Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the cleanest and best maintained hotels I have stayed in, regardless of class. And at around $75 CAD per night, it's a great value. My room was small but comfortable with nice new furnishing and immaculate housekeeping. If you ask for a room facing the interior you won't have a view but you wil have peace and quiet. Granville St. gets rather noisy at night with clubs catering to Vancouver's youth. The area is not at all bad and rapidly gentrifying. If you are a city person you will be more than satisfied with this location as it is convenient to everything on foot or by bus. The only drawback here is the Wi-Fi. While it is free to use, the signal is pitifully weak. Staff told me that was true throughout the building except in the lobby area where it is only slightly stronger. In my room I was not able to hold a connection and eventually gave up trying. Not sure why the hotel invested in wi-fi if it's so dismal. If you're planning to use wi-fi, this hotel is not the place for you. Otherwise, go for it and you'll be more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived a little worried, left happy”
Reviews.Author: Jules_C21
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews and being one of two female 30 somethings travelling together, I was a little worried about our choice. BUT we emailed the hotel from Australia and always got a prompt, polite reply (thanks Richard). Apparently it can be really noisy on weekends but we were there mid week - little traffic noise but no major problems. Yes there are adult book stores, beggars etc. but no more than you would get in any other major city. We walked everywhere, even at night - just have a healthy sense of awareness but we felt completely safe. Rooms were small but they were clean, had comfy bed and reasonable bathroom. It was a good, cost effective option for us in a convenient location. Would may be think twice about staying there on Fri / Sat unless you are a party aminal but other than that, go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated every minute”
Reviews.Author: sxeagle
Reviews.Content: Date: 21st June 2006 Just a dreadful experience from the almost impossibility of parking a full-size car in the only available and very limited space of the smaller parking lot, trying to manoeuvre suitcases over concrete blocks and through a gap in the lot's fencing, and then to find it was a slow and ineffiecient check-in due to a lack of trained staff (the manager seemed grossly over-worked). The room's air-conditioning unit was ineffective and completely useless at night as it was fully covered by the window curtains, which didn't make sleeping in the small double bed any easier especially as ithe bed had a significant dip in the middle. My wife and I made a brief walking tour of the vicinity but quickly returned to get away from the multitude of beggars who accosted us on the street, from doorways, and even in the nearby 7-Eleven entrance way. An unpleasant hotel in an unpleasant district of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: jdharmonjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and were pleased with this hotel. I wouldn't call me or my wife "party animals" but we enjoyed the energy in the area around the hotel. Reminded us of New York. We felt completely safe and would hardly call it "scuzzy". The room was a little small but we spent so little time in our room it only mattered that our bed was comfortable. Upon our return after our first night, the room was cleaned and in order. The location was great and everything was within walking distance. Really appreciated the proximity to Yaletown and the Granville Area. We would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, people give this place way too many good reviews although I must admit, the rooms were nicer than expected. The location is in scumsville vancouver, lots of bums, hookers, drugdealers, etc at night. Though the room looked nice and clean, we had half empty bottles of hotel shampoo and mouthwash. Both my girlfriend and I found ourselves very itchy at night, and it was very noisy. We could hear the people upstairs and outside our room in the middle of the night. I understand that this is a 2 star hotel, but c'mon, I paid $153.10+taxes (peak season i guess) What bothered me the most was the service I received. Both staff members I dealt with, one of which was a manager, were very rude and impolite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by first appearances”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: At first glance the area does not seem too welcoming, with a number of "adult" shops, pan-handlers & nightclubs. However, when settled in I found it a very convenient location. A number of similar range hotels (Holiday Inn, Best Western, etc) are all around about, as are a some nice coffee shops & convenience stores. The fact there is a lot of nightlife means it is always busy & you need not worry about being in a deserted part of town at any time. The panhandlers are not at all aggresive so are not a problem. It is around a 15 minute walk to the harbour centre & less to the main shops on Robson Street. There is not an underground station handy & due to roadworks, the buses were not covering the area during my visit-but taxis are plentiful & reasonably priced if you're not up for the walk. The rooms are pleasant (although you do get some traffic noise) with comfy beds, coffee-maker, hairdryer & clean bathrooms. There is a small lounge with computer access for which there is a charge & there is also a laundry room. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but Wings just off the lobby does do a good breakfast. It is a very busy bar in the evening & I felt it was more for drinking & watching sport than for eating (although they do serve food). All in all a convenient reasonably priced option.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel on the "noisy" side of Vancouver, but everything is accessible. Easy walking to restaurants and shopping on Davie and Robson streets. This is a 3 star, so don't expect the Four Seasons, but if you are looking for a clean budget accomodations, this is worth considering. PS: Staff is very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & if pub crawling, you cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am 33, male and traveled to British Columbia alone for my first vacation outside the U.S. Pros to the Howard Johnson on Granville Street: its staff and location. Whether checking in, asking for directions or just chatting, the hotel staff were extremely professional. This was my first trip not only to Vancouver, but to a foreign country, and they were helpful with where to find an ATM or good local places to grab pizza. Secondly, if you're interested in Yaletown, pubs or dance clubs, this location cannot be beat. There is A LOT within walking distance. Two of the best dance clubs in the city are located less than half a block away - and yes - Friday and Saturday nights the bass from the clubs can be heard in your room. If you plan on being in bed before midnight, or spending a lot of time in your room, I would recommend requesting the highest floor available (I was on what would be considered the 4th floor and slept fine) or not staying here at all. I have stayed in much nicer rooms, but again, I did not travel to Vancouver to spend 21 hours a day in the room. It was clean. My only complaint would be a lack of iron to press my clothes, but this was my first day of travel and the clothes on my back looked just fine. I would stress again that I slept great and the club atmosphere from the street did not bother me. The excitement was part of what made Vancouver appealing. I could however see how it might be a concern for senior travelers sleeping on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, comfortable, and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenPerna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HoJo Vancouver for 3 nights this month. I absolutely loved my unique "queen suite" room--spacious with warm yellow tones, huge comfy couch, microwave and mini-fridge, and nicely placed track lighting. They give a free welcome basket with microwave popcorn, granola bars, and bottled water. My room had a nice view of the downtown city lights. I loved coming back to my room each evening. The lobby was clean and welcoming, and there was a cute little lounge on the second floor in which to sit and relax. The halls were very clean and decorated nicely, and I felt safe that you had to swipe a card to get up to the rooms. Staff were helpful and nice. The restaurant attached to the lobby, Wings, was inexpensive, delicious, and had friendly staff. Parking was no problem in the lot adjacent to the hotel (for $12/night). Staff did tell me to empty out my car due to crime, which I did, and I never had any problems. I could walk to many restaurants and shopping, and even walked back from the Harbor Center (about 25 minutes). There were some grungy people hanging out on Granville, but I think they were waiting for the bus or just talking to each other, and nobody bothered me. I'm from San Francisco, so I didn't mind the downtown atmosphere. Even at night there were tons of people around at the various nightclubs and bars, and I felt safe walking down the street for a slice of pizza. If the previous negative reviews are accurate, this hotel has made MAJOR changes recently. This was a classy hotel and will soon earn a wonderful reputation. My only drawbacks are that you had to pay to use the Internet in the lobby (most hotels that I've stayed in offer this for free), the parking was expensive (but I guess that's the going rate for downtown), and there was no free breakfast (almost all hotels I stay in seem to offer the standard complimentary bagels and waffles). However, none of this would stop me from staying at this HoJo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great city”
Reviews.Author: roselilycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson on Granville from 11-18 February and 25 February to 1 March 2006. We had an excellent stay here – starting from the friendly helpful front desk staff to the housekeeping staff. Nothing was a problem for any of the staff. The rooms were on the small size as we needed a roll-away bed in addition to the two double beds already there. However, we were out and about every day so it wasn’t a major problem. The rooms were very clean. It was also very secure as one needed to swipe a room key to gain access to the elevator up to the accommodation levels. The hotel’s location is excellent for access to downtown and also the dining and shopping along Davie Street. It’s a bit down and out on the street around the hotel but there are worse areas in Sydney where I know many hotels are located which house international visitors. Having stayed in Vancouver on previous visits at different hotels, I would definitely pick the Howard Johnson for my next visit for its convenience to Robson Street and downtown, the friendly staff and the overall ambience of the hotel. And of course attached to the hotel is Wings where we dined quite a few times. Good food, reasonable prices and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Entertainment downtown location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank you guys for the awesome customer service from Front Desk, housekeepers, restaurant servers and specially the good looking friendly staff of the night club! I will definetely recommend your hotel to all my friends and family. Keep up the wonderful service and the look of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “exceded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Howard Johnson Hotel on Grandville for two days. I wish to recomend all the staff for being friendly and courteous and professional. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown close to shopping and restaurants. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Vancouver and stayed at the HOJO for a few nights. Only to be greeted with the utmost friendliest staff I have ever encountered. I have travelled all over the world and I am most pleased here in Vancouver. The location is great! You have everything you need and want right outside the front doors. I would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Vancouver. Very, very clean suites and comfortable to lay a tired body.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Comforable - but gritty area at night”
Reviews.Author: GreenIT
Reviews.Content: As any good consultant would tell you, your satisfaction with this hotel will depend.... If you are comfortable in an urban area with panhandlers approaching you and sifting through a sidewalk with habituees of the bar scene, this comfortable, courteous and cheap hotel will fit the bill. If you are with a family or planning a romantic getaway or just have trouble with the grittier side of life, I would highly recommend going toward the west end and trying to find something closer to Stanley Park...or maybe a B&B outside of town. We were told to "empty our car of all its contents" after we navigated through the raucous crowd from the gravelly parking lot. In the 100 yards from lot to door, we were also asked for money twice. It was 11pm though. It looked much better in the light of day. If I were in college, I'd stay here again. I'm 25 years past that. So, next time, I will shell out the money and stay closer to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel in downtown Vancouver, location a bit seedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson accomodation is very nice inside, with rooms newly renovated, personal air conditioning in each room, and friendly service. The rooms are fairly small with no view, but very nice if all you want is a place to sleep. The only downside is that the street outside is in a fringe area with homeless, strip clubs, etc. It is safe enough to walk to everything during the day, but I would be wary to walk around alone at night. However, a lot of the cheaper Vancouver hotels are in this same area, so if you want a good price there is not much option. For those who can afford to pay more, I would recommend the Robson Street hotels nearer to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the west”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the howard johnson yesterday when I arrived in vancouver. When I checked in I was greeted by the bellhop who kindly offered to take my luggage for me. I had an easy and rapid check in with the friendly clerks at the front desk. On my way to my room I was greeted by friendly maids, and right away, I was asked if there was anything else i needed to make my stay more enjoyable. The rooms which had been newly renovated where very clean and smelled very nice. I highly recomend this hotel to anyone who will be staying in or around downtown vancouver. thanks howard johnson for making my stay an enjoyable one. YOU GUYS ROCK!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Hotel Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 1176 Granville Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 1L8, Canada
